intro: Sison carvifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sison, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often aromatic, giving it a distinctive scent. Its yellow-orange flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Sison carvifolium is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
